pullRequest.body:
add a typeclass `CountablySeparated _` abbreviating `HasCountableSeparatingOn _ MeasurableSet univ`. This is a common assumption is measure theory and is already used often in the library. 

Additionally, mathlib was previously not consistent in choosing between the equivalent spellings `HasCountableSeparatingOn X MeasurableSet s` and `HasCountableSeparatingOn s MeasurableSet univ` for X a measurable space and `s : Set X`. (In the latter spelling, `s` is being coerced to the subtype of `X`.) Lemmas and instances are added to help unify the situation.  This is now spelled `CountablySeparated s`. 

---

nodes.body: Thanks once again for taking a look!

Thanks!
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8935762646/job/24544829164)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8935762646/job/24544829006)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8935762646/job/24544829623)
It looks good!
It looks good!
Can you comment on the change in priority? Why did you change it and why did you set it to that value in particular?

I increased it because some proofs in Constructions.Polish were timing out. You can see these in the result of CI on [this commit](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/12433/commits/73d6643f1fd2596d564b3b1687420ca81ab7a1cd)

I did not put any thought into the specific value other than making it higher. I do think it makes sense for the priority to be quite high. This plus [instHasCountableSeparatingOnIsOpen](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/CountableSeparatingOn.html#instHasCountableSeparatingOnIsOpen) should almost always be how instances of `CountableSeparated` are generated for Borel spaces.

```suggestion
    [h : CountablySeparated α] {s : Set α} : CountablySeparated s := by
```

The name looks reversed compared to the statement:
```suggestion
instance hasCountableSeparatingOn_of_countablySeparated_subtype
```

Name reversed here as well:
```suggestion
instance countablySeparated_subtype_of_hasCountableSeparatingOn
```

```suggestion
  simp_rw [countablySeparated_def] at *
```

```suggestion
    rw [CountablySeparated.subtype_iff]
```

Could you replace `=>` by `↦` for functions everywhere in you code?
```suggestion
  ⟨fun h ↦ h.countably_separated, fun h ↦ ⟨h⟩⟩
```
I checked the style guide to be sure it's not just my personal preference: https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/style.html contains "The Lean default for this is `fun x => x * x`, but the `↦` arrow (inserted with \mapsto) is also valid. In mathlib the pretty printer displays `↦`, and we slightly prefer this in the source as well."

There are many `=>` still in mathlib but they are mostly due to the automatic Lean3 to Lean4 translation done by mathport.
I think I got them all, thanks.
Did you check if the todo of the line above still causes issues? (TODO: make this an instance)

Yeah, i just tried it and it still causes a number of timeouts in `BorelSpace.Basic`. 

Giving it a low priority fixes some of these, but this one seems to timeout no matter what:
```
instance : MeasurableSMul ℝ≥0 ℝ≥0∞ where
  measurable_const_smul := by
    simp_rw [ENNReal.smul_def]
    exact fun _ ↦ MeasurableSMul.measurable_const_smul _
  measurable_smul_const := fun x ↦ by
    simp_rw [ENNReal.smul_def]
    exact measurable_coe_nnreal_ennreal.mul_const _
```

Just checking that I understand the reason for the removal of this instance: that's not needed anymore because the hypotheses imply SeparatesPoints, and CountablyGenerated + SeparatesPoints imply CountablySeparated?

Indeed, `inferInstance` is able to prove this. 

This might not have been true previously since `HasCountableSeparatingOn _ MeasurableSet s` is not defeq to `HasCountableSeparatingOn s MeasurableSet univ`

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(MeasureTheory): add CountablySeparated
